meanings.definition: A person or thing that digests.
meanings.sent1: My pet rabbit is a good digestors of carrots and lettuce.
meanings.sent2: The digestors in our stomachs help break down the food we eat.
meanings.sent3: The little robot claimed to be a digestors of information, always eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a powerful digestors, processing complex ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The digestors in nature, like earthworms, play a vital role in recycling nutrients.

meanings.definition: A device or machine that breaks down organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The compost digestors in our backyard help turn food scraps into nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: The industrial digestors at the waste treatment plant efficiently process sewage.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning digestors in the factory caused a stinky mess.
meanings.sent4: The digestors hummed softly as they worked, breaking down the waste into usable components.
meanings.sent5: The powerful digestors resembled giant metal stomachs, churning and breaking down the organic waste.

meanings.definition: A chemical substance that aids in digestion.
meanings.sent1: Probiotics are natural digestors that help maintain a healthy gut.
meanings.sent2: Enzymes are essential digestors that break down food into nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a secret digestors to the marinade to make it easier to digest.
meanings.sent4: The herbal digestors in the tea helped soothe the upset stomach.
meanings.sent5: The doctor prescribed digestive digestors to improve the patient's digestion.
